other_tests.findings: The gallbladder is distended measuring 16.2 x 5.4 x 5.4 cm with significant gallbladder wall edema and associated inflammation. There are 4 large gallstones layering dependently and 1 stone measuring 1.8 cm impacted in the neck of the gallbladder, causing intrinsic compression of the proximal common hepatic duct resulting in mild intrahepatic biliary dilatation. The common bile duct is of normal caliber with no evidence of choledocholithiasis. The liver, pancreas, spleen, adrenal glands, and kidneys show no focal lesions or significant abnormalities. There is a trace amount of perihepatic ascites and atelectasis noted at the right lung base.
